reviews.review:
Поиск матчей + и -
1. За выжившего довольно легко и быстро найти матч ( + )
2. Иногда при поиске матча можно прождать не одну минуту, за убийцу это заметить легче всего, тк иногда приходится ждать больше 5-10 минут ( - )
Геймплей + и -
1. Довольно завлекает на начале игры, разнообразием всего в целом. 
2. Горсть багов, хотя в некоторых местах я бы сказал целый мешок. 
3. Большой выбор персонажей, да, по началу большинство из них закрыты, но после того как вы освоитесь их количество значительно вырастет.

Dead by Daylight is a game that had me almost completely undecided as to whether or not I would recommend it. While my playtime is limited as of time of writing, I can wholeheartedly say that one experience that I'm sure doesn't change with playtime is community interaction. I had a handful or matches as both killer and survivor, and I witnessed a lot of abuse between players in survivor groups, as well as abuse targeted at killers that, in all fairness, were simply doing what the tutorials and guides told them to do. My community experience (including browsing the subreddit) has only shown me how toxic the player base is for this game, and I'm sure you'll see lots of sarcastic "funny" votes on this review in response to that statement.

Community issues aside, the gameplay for DbD is very fun, and had me on the edge of my seat for a fair bit of my playtime. So far I have been able to land quite a few quad kills while playing killer, and I even managed a few skin-of-my-teeth escapes from the likes of The Hag and The Cannibal. If you're able to play smart on both sides of the coin, then DbD will reward you in a lot of ways. Mastery over timing, QTE's, and interaction prompts as survivor (which might feel clunky at first) will come more naturally the more you do them. Understanding when hits will land and how to use powers as killer makes the game a breeze, so long as you can manage to drum up even a modicum of cunning.

In summation, if you have the thick skin required to easily brush off insults and crude racial slurs and are willing to put a little time and effort into learning mechanics, then Dead by Daylight can be a very enjoyable experience. With even more time and effort you can find yourself racking up kills and escapes in no time. Just don't expect a warm welcome.

I believe that the developers of the game are Egoistic! They just don't like listening to the players and always trying to go on their way. I've been playing this game since Sept 2020 and I am surprised that bugs that have been in the game since day 1 still exists. They would normally launch a PTB so they can get feedback from the players but it seems those are being ignored. They just recently launch the latest update and it is, by far, one of the worst. Nothing was followed from the feedback and now they are trying to fix it by going back to the community's feedback. If they have done it in the first place, this wouldn't gotten worst.
Here are some of the BAD changes I have experienced:
1. They made the animation very slow so survivors are not that responsive compare before. 
2. The camera has been zoomed, you can see fewer compare to what is used to be.
3. If you've pallet stunned the killer, it would end up going to you side so you have to vault back.
4. The safety Pip has been removed so now it's either you earn pip or you lose a pip.
5. The hitbox is insanely huuuuuge! The hitbox has been one of the issues even before but now it gotten worst. If you notice, a lot of of killers are swinging from afar hoping it would hit.

It's funny they didn't even prioritize any of these but instead they are busy fixing the HUD. We have to endure these stupid bugs until they release the 4.5.2. The decision-making skill of these developers are so poor.
